title: Ticket #212: GCB reports negative freesockets
description:
The following was copied from email and has been anonymized.

External user:

I connected also machine deleted now with suggested attributes included, 50k of sockets available.

We were running during the night again of of sockets with two gcbs :(, looking at the plots on machine deleted, it was hard time for glideins...

% date
Fri Feb 13 10:51:41 CST 2009
% ./gcb_broker_query XXX.XXX.XXX.222 freesockets
freesockets = -221

% ./gcb_broker_query XXX.XXX.XXX.243 freesockets
freesockets = -54

Back to Alan.

The effect of negative freesockets is that Condor will stop using the broker.

Retrying the tests at approximately, Fri Feb 13 1:30:00 CST 2009, on the same machines

% gcb_broker_query XXX.XXX.XXX.222 freesockets
freesockets = 10
% gcb_broker_query XXX.XXX.XXX.243 freesockets
freesockets = 4877
remarks:
2009-Feb-13 15:38:15 by adesmet:
From the user:

PS: The following GCBs (XXX.XXX.XXX.222,XXX.XXX.XXX.243,XXX.XXX.XXX.225)
are in charge at the moment
% date
Fri Feb 13 10:51:41 CST 2009
% ./gcb_broker_query XXX.XXX.XXX.222
freesockets
freesockets = -221

% ./gcb_broker_query XXX.XXX.XXX.243
freesockets
freesockets = -54

from timestamp, after couple of minutes, situation changed, when I added
fcdftest014:
% date
Fri Feb 13 11:17:37 CST 2009
% ./gcb_broker_query XXX.XXX.XXX.225
freesockets
freesockets = 48278

% ./gcb_broker_query XXX.XXX.XXX.243
freesockets
freesockets = 2466

2009-Feb-16 10:34:26 by adesmet:
The daemon is running in a user account, and nothing is in place to automatically restart it.

2009-Feb-18 14:12:25 by adesmet:
User only saw this in a default configuration used for testing. In production it's not present. So putting this on a back burner for a bit to catch up on other tasks.

2010-Jan-14 17:34:25 by adesmet:
GCB may not be long for this world. For now, abandoning.
